meanings.definition: A vehicle with four wheels drawn by horses.
meanings.sent1: The carriage rolled smoothly down the cobblestone street.
meanings.sent2: The princess arrived at the ball in a beautiful carriage.
meanings.sent3: The carriage driver comically tried to control the spirited horses.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the carriage like music.
meanings.sent5: The golden carriage gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of luxury and elegance.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods or people from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The carriage of goods by train is efficient and cost-effective.
meanings.sent2: The carriage of passengers on the bus was delayed due to traffic.
meanings.sent3: The carriage of the heavy boxes made the delivery man sweat profusely.
meanings.sent4: The carriage of emotions in her voice was evident to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The carriage of memories in her heart weighed heavily on her soul.

meanings.definition: The manner in which someone carries themselves.
meanings.sent1: Her graceful carriage caught the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: His confident carriage showed he was a natural leader.
meanings.sent3: The carriage of the shy girl seemed to shrink in the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: The carriage of the actor on stage exuded charisma and charm.
meanings.sent5: The carriage of the ballerina was as light as a feather, captivating the audience.
